Description: Gold sheet with Greek inscription preserved. Probably a dedication, possibly a fragment from a diadem.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Town (Naukratis), Found by locals looting the site between 1884-5 “south-west of the town at a high part, lying in the loose dust among the houses”
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Egyptian Museum, Cairo. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Briefly noted by Petrie, (Journal 1884-1885, 156, EES Archive XVII 47).
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (p. 43-4, pl. XXVII)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (QB.02) (Phase 3)
